item.title: Barplots
item.description: Let’s create a bar plot as our final example. library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Barplots are more complicated to create than histograms, time series, and scatterplots.First let’s extract the data. In order to make name a factor and team name a level of that factor, we have to write the following query: query<-"select name,HR from Teams where yearID=1980 order by HR" result<-sqldf(query) result$name<-factor(result$name,levels=result$name) Now to make the actual barplot.We use “coord_flip” to switch the y and x axis.
